title: New York - poverty rate 2000 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Percentage of population, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2018 to 2013.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2011 to 2008.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2013 to 2011.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2008 to 2006.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2006 to 2004.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2004 to 2002.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2002 to 2000.
gold: This statistic shows the poverty rate in New York from 2000 to 2018 . 13.6 percent of New York 's population lived below the poverty line in 2018 .
